faq.q4: Which format should I choose for music?
faq.a4: For highest quality, use FLAC (lossless) or WAV. For everyday use with smaller files, MP3 at 256-320kbps or AAC at 192-256kbps offer excellent quality. OGG Vorbis provides great quality at lower bitrates.
faq.q5: Will converting between formats reduce quality?
faq.a5: Converting from lossless (FLAC, WAV) to lossy (MP3, AAC) will reduce quality slightly. Converting between lossy formats causes generational loss and should be avoided—use the original format or convert from lossless sources.
